callouts.step-prepare: Keep operating procedures and bypass approvals current. Know how to reach the Incident Commander after hours.
callouts.step-identify: Report alarms and abnormal behavior immediately. Capture screenshots without changing configurations.
callouts.step-investigate: Coordinate isolations with Technical Lead; avoid ad-hoc changes that could disrupt control systems.
callouts.step-respond: Execute approved containment runbooks only when the Incident Commander authorizes them.
callouts.step-recover: Validate processes during staged recovery and confirm controls respond normally before reconnecting.
callouts.step-followup: Provide operator view of impacts and timing for lessons learned.
callouts.general: Stay focused on safety and reliability. Escalate quickly and document what you observe.
callouts.definitions: Use the official terms when talking to engineering or ECS so they can triage quickly.
callouts.triage: Confirm operational effects when severity is being declared; your input sets priority.
callouts.flow: Keep the six-step flow visible in the control room binder.
callouts.comms: Route media inquiries to PIO. Avoid personal messaging apps for incident chatter.
callouts.reporting: Share facts with compliance; do not send statements externally.
callouts.evidence: Preserve logs by exporting copies; do not alter controllers while collecting evidence.
callouts.audit: If asked, describe what you did and reference the logbook entries.
callouts.scenarios: Map each scenario to potential plant or feeder effects.
callouts.quiz: Answer based on operations reality—safety first.
callouts.checklist: Use the checklist during shift handoff to confirm readiness.
callouts.certificate: Your role on the certificate shows you completed operator-focused training.

callouts.step-prepare: Maintain hardened baselines, backups, and tested restore images for OT servers and workstations.
callouts.step-identify: Validate alarms against approved change windows before escalating.
callouts.step-investigate: Collect forensic data using approved tools and capture hashes; avoid using untrusted utilities.
callouts.step-respond: Implement containment (accounts, ACLs, segmentation) with Incident Commander approval and ops coordination.
callouts.step-recover: Restore from clean sources and document configuration changes applied during recovery.
callouts.step-followup: Update baseline images and patch status after lessons learned are approved.
callouts.general: Keep configuration records and change tickets ready for investigators.
callouts.definitions: Flag attempts to compromise even if blocked; they inform tuning and patching.
callouts.triage: Provide evidence of scope and affected systems when severity is declared.
callouts.flow: Tie each admin action to the corresponding CSIR step for clarity.
callouts.comms: Route vendor coordination through Incident Commander to avoid conflicting changes.
callouts.reporting: Hand off accurate system inventories for any regulatory notification.
callouts.evidence: Store disk images and logs in evidence repositories with hashes recorded.
callouts.audit: Show configuration baselines and change history when asked.
callouts.scenarios: Consider dependencies (domain controllers, jump hosts, AV servers) in each scenario.
callouts.quiz: Think about containment feasibility in OT zones.
callouts.checklist: Use checklists before maintenance to confirm backups and rollback plans.
callouts.certificate: Shows you completed system-administration focused CSIR training.

callouts.step-prepare: Keep detection content, IR kits, and evidence procedures current; align with OT constraints.
callouts.step-identify: Drive validation and severity determination with Incident Commander and Technical Lead.
callouts.step-investigate: Lead scoping, forensics, and containment options. Protect evidence integrity.
callouts.step-respond: Coordinate eradication and communications timing with PIO and operations.
callouts.step-recover: Verify systems are clean before reconnecting; recommend monitoring thresholds.
callouts.step-followup: Document root cause, dwell time, and control gaps for action tracking.
callouts.general: You anchor CSIR execution; keep records and rationale for every recommendation.
callouts.definitions: Use formal definitions when coordinating with compliance and PSA.
callouts.triage: Lead the triage worksheet and ensure decision logs are stored.
callouts.flow: Ensure transitions between steps are documented and justified.
callouts.comms: Prepare executive-ready updates while protecting investigation integrity.
callouts.reporting: Partner with compliance to supply evidence-backed statements.
callouts.evidence: Chain-of-custody must be pristine; avoid cross-contamination.
callouts.audit: Provide timelines, playbooks, and evidence inventories.
callouts.scenarios: Highlight containment paths that maintain grid safety.
callouts.quiz: Base answers on CSIR Plan expectations for responders.
callouts.checklist: Verify checklist aligns with current detection and response playbooks.
callouts.certificate: Captures your responder role at completion.

callouts.step-prepare: Ensure retention, reporting matrices, and evidence templates match the CSIR Plan.
callouts.step-identify: Confirm reportable thresholds and timers are tracked once severity is declared.
callouts.step-investigate: Monitor evidence handling to satisfy audit and legal needs.
callouts.step-respond: Log decisions and approvals for containment and eradication.
callouts.step-recover: Capture restoration approvals and configuration baselines for audit trails.
callouts.step-followup: Lead documentation updates and tracking of corrective actions.
callouts.general: You safeguard documentation quality and reporting accuracy.
callouts.definitions: Ensure teams use the correct terminology in tickets and reports.
callouts.triage: Record who set severity and why; retain artifacts that support the decision.
callouts.flow: Verify every step has evidence stored with retention metadata.
callouts.comms: Coordinate with PIO to ensure messaging aligns with obligations.
callouts.reporting: Prepare and submit regulatory reports on time with supporting evidence.
callouts.evidence: Check that hashes, custodians, and storage locations are logged.
callouts.audit: Lead audit responses and ensure professional conduct.
callouts.scenarios: Assess whether scenario responses produce adequate evidence and logs.
callouts.quiz: Focus on obligations and documentation discipline.
callouts.checklist: Verify checklist items trace back to CSIR Plan requirements.
callouts.certificate: Records you completed compliance-aware CSIR training.

callouts.step-prepare: Know how to reach the Incident Commander or ECS when something looks wrong.
callouts.step-identify: Report suspicious emails or device behavior immediately; do not attempt your own fixes.
callouts.step-investigate: Avoid touching suspected systems; wait for guidance.
callouts.step-respond: Follow instructions and do not discuss incidents externally.
callouts.step-recover: Validate your business processes once systems are restored.
callouts.step-followup: Share observations that can improve awareness training.
callouts.general: Escalate fast and avoid speculation. Your prompt reports protect operations.
callouts.definitions: Use the term ‘suspected incident’ when escalating to avoid confusion.
callouts.triage: Provide impact context for your area; do not overstate or understate effects.
callouts.flow: Know the six steps exist so you understand progress updates.
callouts.comms: Direct any media or vendor inquiries to PIO/Incident Commander.
callouts.reporting: If asked for input, provide factual timelines only.
callouts.evidence: Save emails or screenshots as requested; do not forward sensitive details widely.
callouts.audit: If interviewed, keep answers brief and factual.
callouts.scenarios: Consider how your daily tools might signal an issue.
callouts.checklist: Use the checklist as a reminder of how to escalate and cooperate.
callouts.certificate: Shows you learned how to escalate and support CSIR.
